required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transthoracic Echocardiography of Ventricular Function of Parturients in Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Transthoracic Echocardiography of Cardiac Function of Parturients in Labor

brief_summary.textblock: This echocardiography study will characterize heart structure and function during labor. Imaging of the heart during the stress of labor could increase detection of subclinical cardiovascular disease using advanced imaging techniques. Cardiac serum biomarkers and complication rates will also be measured and compared between patients with and without evidence of cardiovascular disease on echocardiography.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients with an abnormal strain pattern as compared to parturients not in labor
The proportion of patients with diastolic dysfunction as compared to parturients not in labor

secondary_outcome.description: Comparing estimated right ventricular systolic pressure between patients in active labor as compared to those who are not in active labor (mm Hg)

other_outcome.measure: Left ventricular systolic function
other_outcome.description: Simpson's method of discsmotion abnormalities and diastolic function

other_outcome.measure: Left ventricular myocardial performance index
Total number of patients with the presence of regional wall motion abnormalities
Total number of patients with abnormal global right ventricular dysfunction
Right ventricular strain
Tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion
Tissue doppler s'
Total number of maternal deaths within 0-42 days post-partum
The number of patients with an identifiable Centers for Disease Control Severe Maternal Morbidity Identification complication post-partum
other_outcome.description: Acute myocardial infarction, aortic aneurysm, acute renal failure, adult respiratory distress syndrome, amniotic fluid embolism, cardiac arrest, ventricular fibrillation, conversion of cardiac rhythm, disseminated intravascular coagulation, eclampsia, heart failure, arrest during surgery or procedure, puerperal cerebrovascular disorders, pulmonary edema, aspiration, cardiopulmonary anesthesia complications, sepsis, shock, air or thrombotic embolism, blood product transfusion, hysterectomy, temporary tracheostomy, requiring ventilation

other_outcome.measure: The number of patients with a pulse oximetry reading <90% after delivery
The number of patients who required oxygen administration after delivery
The number of patients who develop atrial fibrillation or premature atrial complexes
The number of patients who develop a stroke
other_outcome.description: Stroke must be verified by imaging including either computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging.

other_outcome.measure: The number of patients with an elevation in transaminase levels during labor or after delivery
Hospital length of stay
other_outcome.description: Total hours from admission to discharge

other_outcome.measure: The number of patients requiring intensive care unit admission within 42 days post delivery
Mortality within 42 days post delivery
The number of patients with a post-partum diagnosis of post-partum hemorrhage
The total number of patients who require additional uterotonic medications other than oxytocin after delivery
other_outcome.description: Medications include additional dosage of oxytocin above 3 units, methylergonovine, carboprost, tranexamic acid or misoprostol

other_outcome.measure: The number of patients requiring a transfusion
other_outcome.description: Cell Saver, red blood cells, platelets, fresh frozen plasma, cryoprecipitate

other_outcome.measure: Blood loss
other_outcome.description: Estimated and quantitated blood loss as well as the difference between pre-delivery hemoglobin and post-delivery lowest hemoglobin during admission

other_outcome.measure: Number of patients requiring vasopressor after delivery to support blood pressure
other_outcome.description: phenylephrine, ephedrine, norepinephrine, epinephrine, vasopressin, inhaled nitrous oxide, inhaled epoprostenol

other_outcome.measure: Activin A level
other_outcome.time_frame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

other_outcome.measure: Placental Growth Factor
other_outcome.time_frame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

other_outcome.measure: Soluble endoglin
other_outcome.time_frame: Less than 3 hours after echocardiogram procedure

study_pop.textblock: Healthy women between 18 and 35 years of age with singleton pregnancy in active labor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All healthy parturients 18 years of age or older with estimated gestation greater than or equal to 37 weeks who are expected to deliver during their hospitalization.
- During the echocardiographic exam, the patient must be in active labor with cervical dilation between 6-10 cm and contractions that are spaced less than 5 minutes apart.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known functional or structural heart disease
- Previously diagnosed pulmonary hypertension.
- Comorbid disease other than diet controlled gestational diabetes, uncomplicated obesity, mild asthma and euthyroid patients with a history of hypo or hyperthyroidism.
- Parturients endorsing active use of non-prescription mind-altering drugs including cocaine, methamphetamine, or ketamine.
- Other non-inclusion criteria include inability to tolerate left lateral positioning either symptomatically or by fetal heart rate monitoring, suspected hypo-or hypercoagulable states that was not previously diagnosed, hemodynamic instability requiring >2 L crystalloid administration within 1 hour time frame after epidural placement or vasopressor administration of >15 mg ephedrine or >300 mcg phenylephrine administration within 1 hour after epidural placement.

eligibility.gender_description: Any pregnant patient, even if gender identity is male.
